page.title: 08FARMS NEAR LOSSIEMOUTH.
page.content: The two arable farms near Lossiemouth are named Balgreen and North Greens. Balgreen has 45 acres of arable land. The ploughing of these fields takes four and a half days to complete. Spring barley and oats are sown,then fertilised and nitrogen added later. During the growing season,the crops are sprayed first with weedkiller and secondly with fungicide.Harvest time is in August and the yield is around 70 tons.The cereal crops are sent to be tested for nitrogen content.This is done by the maltsters.If the crops pass the test, they are soaked then dried before being delivered to local distilleries, as part of the process of whisky-making. North Greens is a smaller arable farm,which follows the same crop procedure as Balgreen.
